intro: Sterculia triloba, commonly known as the African tallow tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The tree produces woody pods that contain oval, hard-shelled seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in various African cultures. The plant is also valued for its durable wood and medicinal properties.
